freshman.title: Freshman Year '08-'09
freshman.teaser: President Barack Obama stopped by the Triangle on his campaign trail for the Nov. 2008 elections.

sophomore.title: Sophomore Year '09-'10
sophomore.teaser: The Duke men’s basketball team won the 2010 NCAA national championships against Butler University.

junior.title: Junior Year '10-'11
junior.teaser: In the Fall of 2010, students celebrated their last Tailgate, canceled after a 14 year old was found unconcious in a Porta Potty.

senior.title: Senior Year '11-'12
senior.teaser: Members of the Black Student Alliance march to the Allen Building with a list of demands regarding concerns of the black community.

Friday, May 11: 4:30 p.m., Duke Chapel: Baccalaureate Service (last names A through G)
Saturday, May 12: 11:30 a.m., Duke Chapel: Baccalaureate Service (last names H through O)
3:00 p.m., Duke Chapel: Baccalaureate Service (last names P through Z)
4:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m., West Campus Quadrangle: President's Reception
8:30 p.m., Duke Chapel: Demonstration Organ Recital
Sunday, May 13: 9:30 a.m., Football Practice Field: Procession of Candidates
10:00 a.m., Wallace Wade Stadium: Commencement Exercises

articles.title: Roshan Sadanani: student commencement speaker
articles.teaser: When delivering a speech to his entire academic class before everyone accepts a degree and goes off into the world, Senior Roshan Sadanani will remember to stay calm.

articles.title: Zakaria to communicate optimism, opportunity in globalized ‘new world’
articles.teaser: More than two years following his first visit to Duke, renowned journalist and author Fareed Zakaria will return to encourage Duke’s graduating seniors in an interconnected world.
